comments:
Starting eclipse allows my to choose a workspace, once you choose ok and eclipse continues to load the splashscreen disappears and doesn't continue to load.  The log inside the chosen workspace has the following:

[yeknom@cave-usi .metadata]$ /home/yeknom/Desktop/eclipse/eclipse 
[yeknom@cave-usi .metadata]$ cat .log

Talking to Pookzilla on irc he concluded.

<Pookzilla> what version of GTK are you running?
<yeknom> Pookzilla: 2.10.11
<Pookzilla> you should probably log a bug against SWT.  Looking at the code from 3.2.1 (trying to get 3.2.2 now) it looks like the cool item creates a toolbar and tool item to do some calculations and then disposes of the bar and item.  The problem is that the disposal of the item then triggers a re-layout of the bar which is already disposed... I'm not sure why this is a problem for you and no one else.

Note: the log was from a 3.2.2 setup but the same behavior happens with 3.3
Bizarre, this has not been reported before.  Have any other releases of eclipse (older or newer) worked for you with this setup?  BG note gtk 2.10.11, java 6.

Yes, some previous versions have worked but i have no clue which ones they where since in the past i'd just use the fedora provided eclipse.  When this first started happening i figured it was just some brokeness from an upgrade or something but it's never started to work again.
I think the cause of this bug was a rogue library that ended up in /usr/local.  Once removed everything seems happy.  So unless you think this needs more investigation all seems good now.

If you're happy, then we're happy. Please reopen if you run into this again.

Closing as WORKSFORME.
